{
  "article_text": [
    "it is well known that free groups are ubiquitous in the automorphism group of an infinite rooted spherically homogeneous tree , see for instance  @xcite , though explicit examples ( especially ones generated by finite automata ) were not so easy to construct , see  @xcite .    on the other hand , many famous groups , which are defined by their action on rooted trees do not have free subgroups .",
    "absence of free subgroups is proved in different ways . in some cases it follows from torsion or sub - exponential growth ( as in the grigorchuk groups  @xcite and gupta - sidki groups  @xcite ) . in other cases",
    "it is proved using some contraction arguments ( see , for instance  @xcite ) .",
    "s.  sidki has proved in  @xcite absence of free groups generated by `` automata of polynomial growth '' , which covers many examples .",
    "an important class of groups acting on rooted trees are the _ contracting self - similar groups_. they appear naturally as iterated monodromy groups of expanding dynamical systems ( see  @xcite ) . there are no known examples of contracting self - similar groups with free subgroups and it was a folklore conjecture that they do not exist .",
    "the intuition behind this conjecture and the theorems mentioned above is that there is no sufficient `` room '' for free subgroups .",
    "the action of the elements of the groups in all examples are concentrated on small portions of the tree and the graphs of the action of the groups on the boundary of the rooted tree are also small in some sense .",
    "for instance , the graphs of the action of contracting groups have polynomial growth .",
    "we prove in our paper the following theorem formalizing this intuition .",
    "* theorem  [ th : mainlemma ] .",
    "*    _ let @xmath0 be a group acting faithfully on a locally finite rooted tree @xmath1 .",
    "then one of the following holds .",
    "@xmath0 has no free non - abelian subgroups , 2 .",
    "there is a free non - abelian subgroup @xmath5 and a point @xmath4 such that the stabilizer @xmath6 is trivial , 3 .",
    "there is a point @xmath4 such that the group of @xmath0-germs @xmath7 has a free non - abelian subgroup .    here",
    "the group of @xmath0-germs @xmath7 is the quotient of the stabilizer @xmath8 by the subgroup of automorphisms @xmath9 of the tree @xmath1 acting trivially on a neighborhood @xmath10 of @xmath2 .",
    "theorem  [ th : mainlemma ] was inspired by a result of m.  abrt implying that if @xmath11 is a free group acting faithfully and level transitively on a rooted tree , then there exists a point of the boundary of the tree having trivial stabilizer in @xmath11 , see  @xcite .    even though the theorem itself is not very complicated",
    ", it gives a way to find simple proofs of absence of free subgroups in many groups acting on rooted trees .",
    "one has to show that the graphs of the action of the group on the boundary are so small that a free action of a free subgroup is not possible , and then to analyze the action of the elements of the group on neighborhoods of fixed points in order to show that the groups of germs of the action are also small and have no free subgroups .",
    "in particular , we confirm the conjecture on contracting groups",
    ".    * theorem  [ th : contracting ] . * _ contracting groups have no free subgroups . _    this theorem implies , for instance , that the iterated monodromy groups of post - critically finite rational functions and other expanding dynamical systems ( see  @xcite ) have no free subgroups .",
    "it is an interesting open question if all contracting groups are amenable .",
    "we also generalize ( in theorem  [ th : bounded ] ) the fact that there are no free groups generated by bounded automorphisms of a rooted tree . for the notion of bounded automorphisms see definition  [ def : bdd ] of our paper and the articles  @xcite .",
    "it is known that groups generated by bounded automorphisms _ defined by finite automata _ have no free subgroups  @xcite and that they are even amenable  @xcite .",
    "absence of free subgroups for the general case of bounded automorphisms is proved here for the first time .",
    "it is not known if they are all amenable .",
    "we also give a shorter proof of the theorem of s.  sidki  @xcite about automata of polynomial growth ( only for the case of finite alphabets ) .",
    "a very intriguing open question now is to see if all the groups covered by these theorems are amenable and to prove a theorem on amenability of groups acting on rooted trees similar to theorem  [ th : mainlemma ] . the first more or less general result in this direction is the proof of amenability of groups generated by bounded automata in  @xcite",
    "here we recall the basic notions related to rooted trees and fix notation .",
    "the reader can find more on this in  @xcite .",
    "a _ rooted tree _ is a tree with a fixed vertex called the _ root _ of the tree .",
    "we consider only locally finite trees in our paper , i.e. , trees in which every vertex belongs to a finite number of edges .",
    "we say that a vertex @xmath12 of a tree @xmath1 is _ below _ a vertex @xmath13 if the path from the root of @xmath1 to @xmath12 goes through @xmath13 .",
    "we denote by @xmath14 the subtree of all vertices which are below @xmath13 together with @xmath13 serving as a root of @xmath14 .",
    "see figure  [ fig : t ] .",
    "+    the _ boundary _ @xmath3 of the tree @xmath1 is the set of simple infinite paths starting at the root of @xmath1 .",
    "the boundary @xmath15 of a subtree @xmath14 consists then of the paths going through the vertex @xmath13 .",
    "the collection of subsets @xmath15 of @xmath3 is a basis of topology on @xmath3 .",
    "the topological space @xmath3 is compact and totally disconnected .",
    "if @xmath16 is a subtree of @xmath1 , then @xmath17 is a closed subset of @xmath3 in the natural way .",
    "an automorphism of the rooted tree @xmath1 is an automorphism of the tree @xmath1 fixing the root vertex .",
    "every automorphism of @xmath1 fixes also the _ levels _ of the tree as sets . here a _ level number @xmath18 _ of the rooted tree @xmath1 is the set @xmath19 of the vertices on distance @xmath18 from the root .    a rooted tree @xmath1 is said to be _ spherically homogeneous _",
    "if the automorphism group of @xmath1 is transitive on the levels .",
    "if @xmath1 is spherically homogeneous , then @xmath3 is equipped with a natural probability measure @xmath20 defined by the condition that measure of @xmath15 is equal to @xmath21 , where @xmath19 is the level of the vertex @xmath13 .",
    "this is the unique probability measure invariant under the action of the automorphism group of @xmath1 .",
    "let @xmath22 be a finite set , called _ alphabet _ and let @xmath23 be the free monoid generated by @xmath22 , i.e. , the set of finite words @xmath24 over the alphabet @xmath22 , including the empty word @xmath25 .",
    "the set @xmath23 has a natural structure of a rooted tree , where a vertex @xmath26 is connected to the vertices of the form @xmath27 and the empty word is the root .",
    "we denote by @xmath28 the sub - tree of words starting by @xmath13 , i.e. , the sub - tree @xmath29 of vertices below the vertex @xmath13 .",
    "the boundary @xmath30 is naturally homeomorphic to the set of infinite sequences @xmath31 with the product topology ( where @xmath22 is discrete ) .    more generally ,",
    "if @xmath32 is a sequence of finite sets , then we denote @xmath33 where @xmath34 for @xmath35 and @xmath36 .",
    "we denote by @xmath37 the length of a word @xmath38 , i.e. , number such that @xmath39 .",
    "the set @xmath40 is a rooted tree with the root @xmath25 in which an element @xmath41 is connected to all elements of the form @xmath27 for @xmath42 .",
    "the boundary of the tree @xmath40 is homeomorphic to the direct product @xmath43 of discrete sets .",
    "the invariant measure on @xmath44 coincides in this case with the _ uniform bernoulli _ measure defined as the direct product of the uniform distributions on @xmath45 .",
    "we denote by @xmath46 the sequence @xmath47    if @xmath9 is an automorphsm of the tree @xmath40 , then for every @xmath38 there exists a unique automorphism @xmath48 of the tree @xmath49 such that @xmath50 for all @xmath51 .",
    "it is easy to see that the following properties of this operation hold @xmath52      let @xmath9 be an automorphism of the tree @xmath40 .",
    "a sequence @xmath53 is _",
    "@xmath9-regular _ if there exists a beginning @xmath38 of @xmath2 such that @xmath48 is trivial .",
    "we say that @xmath53 is _ @xmath9-singular _ if it is not @xmath9-regular .",
    "the set of @xmath9-singular points of @xmath44 can be measured using the _ growth _ of the automorphism @xmath9 .",
    "[ def : growthfunction ] let @xmath9 be an automorphism of the spherically homogeneous rooted tree @xmath40 .",
    "then its _ growth function _",
    "is @xmath54    if @xmath55 is a _ rooted _ subtree of @xmath40 , i.e. , a sub - tree containing the root of @xmath40 , then the _ relative growth function _ is @xmath56 and @xmath9 is _ almost finitary on @xmath1 _ if @xmath57 where @xmath58 is the @xmath18th level of the tree @xmath1 .",
    "[ pr : measureregular ] let @xmath1 be a spherically homogeneous rooted subtree of @xmath40 and let @xmath9 be an automorphism of @xmath40 .",
    "then @xmath59 where @xmath19 is the @xmath18th level of the tree @xmath1 and @xmath60 is the set of @xmath9-singular points @xmath61 .",
    "it is easy to see that the set of @xmath9-regular points @xmath53 is open , hence the set @xmath60 is closed in @xmath3 .",
    "it follows from by definitions of @xmath62 and the measure @xmath20 that the number @xmath63 is equal to @xmath64 , where @xmath65 the sequence of the sets @xmath66 for @xmath67 is decreasing and their intersection is @xmath60 , since @xmath60 is closed .",
    "this finishes the proof , by continuity of the measure .",
    "recall that if we have a group @xmath0 generated by a finite symmetric set @xmath68 and acting on a set @xmath69 , then the corresponding schreier graph is the graph with the set of vertices @xmath69 and the set of edges @xmath70 , where an edge @xmath71 starts in @xmath72 and ends in @xmath73 .",
    "a locally finite graph is said to be _ amenable _ if for every @xmath74 there exists a finite set @xmath75 such that @xmath76 where @xmath77 is the set of edges beginning in @xmath75 and ending outside of @xmath75 . a regular tree , in particular the cayley graph of a free non - abelian group , is an example of a _ non_-amenable graph .    [ pr : griamenable ]",
    "let @xmath0 be a finitely generated automorphism group of @xmath40 and let @xmath55 be a @xmath0-invariant rooted subtree on which @xmath0 acts level transitively .",
    "if all elements of @xmath0 are almost finitary on @xmath1 , then all components of the schreier graph of the action of @xmath0 on @xmath78 are amenable .",
    "the proposition follows directly from the theorem of  @xcite ( which in turn is a corollary of a result of v.  kaimanovich  @xcite ) .",
    "but we prefer to give here a direct proof constructing the sets @xmath75 ( called _ flner sets _ ) .",
    "fix a finite symmetric generating set @xmath68 of @xmath0 and consider the schreier graph @xmath79 of the action of @xmath0 on the @xmath18th level @xmath19 of the tree @xmath1 .",
    "let @xmath80 be the subgraph of @xmath79 which consists only of the edges @xmath81 such that @xmath82 is trivial .",
    "note that if @xmath81 belongs to @xmath80 , then the inverse edge @xmath83 also belongs to @xmath80 .",
    "the number of edges in the difference @xmath84 is equal to @xmath85 .",
    "let @xmath86 be the connected components of @xmath80 ( as sets of vertices ) .",
    "then in @xmath79 we have @xmath87 hence there exists a component @xmath88 such that @xmath89    consider an orbit @xmath90 of the action of @xmath0 on @xmath3 .",
    "since the action of @xmath0 on @xmath1 is level - transtive , there exists @xmath91 such that the beginning @xmath92 of length @xmath18 of @xmath2 belongs to @xmath88 .",
    "let @xmath93 be such that @xmath94 . by the definition of @xmath88 , for every @xmath95 there exists an element @xmath96 such that @xmath97 and @xmath98 ( see the first two properties of   in subsection  [ ss : words ] ) .",
    "then @xmath99 , i.e. , the point @xmath100 belongs to the orbit @xmath90 .",
    "let @xmath101 if the edge @xmath81 from @xmath95 to @xmath102 belongs to @xmath80 , then @xmath103 , hence @xmath104 belongs to @xmath88 .",
    "consequently , in the schreier graph of the action of @xmath0 on @xmath90 we have @xmath105 as @xmath106 .",
    "this means that @xmath107 are flner sets , i.e. , that the schreier graph of @xmath90 is amenable .",
    "we will use the following simple lemmata .",
    "their proofs are known ( see , for instance proposition 1 of  @xcite for lemma  [ lemma2 ] ) , but we provide them for completeness .    [ lemma1 ] let @xmath11 be a free non - abelian group and let @xmath108 be a cyclic subgroup .",
    "then there exists a free non - abelian subgroup @xmath109 such that @xmath110 is trivial .",
    "we can find a subgroup of @xmath11 freely generated by the generator @xmath111 of @xmath112 and two other elements @xmath113 of @xmath11 ( take , for instance , any element @xmath9 which does not commute with @xmath111 and then take the index 2 subgroup of the free group @xmath114 generated by @xmath115 and @xmath116 ) .",
    "then we can take @xmath117 .",
    "[ lemma2 ] let @xmath11 be a free non - abelian group and let @xmath118 be a homomorphism into a finite direct product of groups .",
    "if every composition @xmath119 of @xmath120 with the projection @xmath121 has a non - trivial kernel , then @xmath120 has a non - trivial kernel .",
    "it is sufficient to prove the lemma for @xmath122 .",
    "the general statement will follow then by induction .",
    "let @xmath123 and @xmath124 be non - trivial elements of the kernels of @xmath125 and @xmath126 , respectively . if @xmath123 and @xmath124 belong to one cyclic subgroup of @xmath11 , then there exist @xmath127 such that @xmath128 is a non - trivial element of the kernel of @xmath120 .",
    "if they do not belong to a common cyclic subgroup , then they do not commute and @xmath129 $ ] is a non - trivial element of the kernel of @xmath120",
    ".    let @xmath0 be a group acting on a topological space @xmath130 .",
    "the _ group of @xmath0-germs _ of a point @xmath131 is the quotient of the stabilizer of @xmath72 in @xmath0 by the subgroup of elements acting trivially on a neighborhood of @xmath72 .",
    "we denote it by @xmath132 .    informally speaking",
    ", @xmath132 describes the action of the stabilizer @xmath133 locally on neighborhoods of @xmath72 .",
    "see an application of groups of germs to growth of groups in  @xcite .",
    "[ th : mainlemma ] let @xmath0 be a group acting faithfully on a locally finite rooted tree @xmath1 .",
    "then one of the following holds .    1 .",
    "@xmath0 has no free non - abelian subgroups , 2 .",
    "there is a free non - abelian subgroup @xmath5 and a point @xmath4 such that the stabilizer @xmath6 is trivial , 3 .",
    "there is a point @xmath4 such that the group of @xmath0-germs @xmath7 has a free non - abelian subgroup .",
    "suppose that on the contrary , @xmath0 has a free subgroup @xmath11 , the groups of @xmath0-germs @xmath7 for all @xmath4 have no free subgroups and there is no free subgroup @xmath134 and a point @xmath4 such that the stabilizer @xmath135 is trivial .",
    "for every point @xmath4 the stabilizer @xmath6 contains a free non - abelian subgroup , since otherwise @xmath6 is cyclic or trivial , and then we can find by lemma  [ lemma1 ] a free non - abelian subgroup @xmath136 such that @xmath137 is trivial .",
    "but the group @xmath7 has no free subgroups , consequently the natural homomorphism @xmath138 has a non - trivial kernel .",
    "this means that there exists a vertex @xmath139 on the path @xmath2 and a non - trivial element of @xmath11 acting trivially on the sub - tree @xmath140 .",
    "we get a covering of @xmath3 by open subsets @xmath141 .",
    "the boundary of the tree is compact , hence there exists a finite sub - covering .",
    "this means that there exists a finite set of vertices @xmath142 such that @xmath143 and for every @xmath144 the group of the elements of @xmath11 acting trivially on @xmath14 is non - trivial , hence infinite",
    ".    denote by @xmath145 the intersection of the stabilizers of the vertices of @xmath142 in @xmath11 .",
    "it is a subgroup of finite index in @xmath11 .",
    "consider the homomorphism @xmath146 mapping an automorphism @xmath147 to the automorphisms of the trees @xmath14 that it induces .",
    "composition of @xmath120 with the projection onto @xmath148 has non - trivial kernel for every @xmath149 , since @xmath145 has finite index in @xmath11 and the group of elements of @xmath11 acting trivially on @xmath14 is infinite for each @xmath144 .",
    "consequently , by lemma  [ lemma2 ] , the kernel of the homomorphism @xmath120 is non - trivial .",
    "but this is not possible , since we assume that @xmath11 acts faithfully on @xmath3 and @xmath150 .",
    "let @xmath11 be a free group .",
    "then there exists a descending series of finite index subgroups @xmath151 with trivial intersection @xmath152 .",
    "every such a series defines an action of @xmath11 on the _ coset tree_. it is the rooted tree with the set of vertices equal to the union @xmath153 of the sets of cosets .",
    "the set @xmath154 is the @xmath18th level of the tree and a vertex @xmath155 is connected by an edge with a vertex @xmath156 if and only if @xmath157 . the group @xmath11 acts then on the coset tree by the natural action on the cosets : @xmath158 the action is level transitive and the stabilizer of the path @xmath159 is equal to the intersection of the subgroups @xmath160 , i.e. , is trivial .",
    "it is not hard to prove ( see , for instance , proposition  4.4 of  @xcite ) that every level transitive action of @xmath11 on a rooted tree @xmath1 for which there exists a path @xmath4 with trivial stabilizer is conjugate to the action on a coset tree .",
    "let @xmath1 be a rooted tree and @xmath161 be an infinite simple path starting in the root , where @xmath162 are the vertices that it goes through .",
    "then the stabilizer of @xmath2 in the @xmath163 is isomorphic to the cartesian product of the automorphism groups of the sub - trees @xmath164 `` hanging '' from the path @xmath2 . for any free group @xmath11 consider a sequence of homomorphisms @xmath165 such that the intersection of kernels @xmath166 is trivial .",
    "then we get a faithful action of @xmath11 on the tree @xmath1 for which @xmath2 is a fixed point .",
    "if the intersection @xmath167 is trivial for every @xmath18 , then the image of @xmath11 in the group of germs @xmath168 is faithful .",
    "a self - similar group @xmath0 of automorphisms of @xmath40 is called _ contracting _ if there exists a finite set @xmath175 such that for every @xmath171 there exists @xmath18 such that @xmath176 for all words @xmath13 of length more than @xmath18 .",
    "the smallest set @xmath177 satisfying this condition is called the _ nucleus _ of the contracting group .",
    "it is proved in  @xcite proposition  2.13.8 that if a finitely generated group @xmath0 is contracting then the growth of the components of the schreier graph of the action of @xmath0 on @xmath44 is polynomial .",
    "let @xmath178 be a subset such that such that @xmath179 , where @xmath177 is the nucleus of the group .",
    "there is @xmath18 such that @xmath176 for all @xmath180 and all @xmath41 . in particular , there exist @xmath181 such that @xmath182 , where @xmath12 is the beginning of the length @xmath18 of the word @xmath2 .",
    "it means that @xmath183 acts trivially on the subtree @xmath184 , i.e. , that the images of @xmath9 and @xmath111 in @xmath7 are equal .",
    "consequently , @xmath7 has no finite subsets of size more than @xmath185 , i.e. , @xmath186 .",
    "we have to eliminate the possibilities ( 2 ) and ( 3 ) of theorem  [ th : mainlemma ] .",
    "note that it is sufficient to prove this theorem for finitely generated contracting groups , since every finitely generated subgroup @xmath187 of a contracting group is a subgroup of a finitely generated contracting group .",
    "one has to take the group generated by all elements of the form @xmath82 for @xmath188 and @xmath38 .",
    "iterated monodromy groups ( see definitions in  @xcite ) of expanding self - coverings of orbispaces , in particular , iterated monodromy groups of post - critically finite rational functions , are contracting hence have no free subgroups . in some cases ( like for the polynomial @xmath189 ,",
    "@xcite ) the iterated monodromy groups have sub - exponential growth , which obviously implies that they have no free subgroups . in some other cases absence of free groups",
    "was proved separately using some contraction arguments .",
    "see for instance a proof of absence of free subgroups in the iterated monodromy group of @xmath190 in  @xcite .",
    "we say that an automorphisms @xmath9 of @xmath40 is _ finitary _ if there exists @xmath18 such that @xmath48 is trivial for all @xmath41 .",
    "( recall that @xmath191 . ) the smallest @xmath18 with this property is called the _ depth _ of @xmath9 .      [",
    "def : bdd ] an automorphism @xmath9 of @xmath40 is _ bounded _ if there exists a finite set of sequences @xmath193 and a number @xmath18 such that if @xmath38 is not a beginning of any sequence @xmath194 then @xmath48 is finitary of depth at most @xmath18 . the number @xmath18 is called the _ finitary depth _ of @xmath9 and the set @xmath195 is called the set of _ directions _ of @xmath9 .",
    "suppose that the group generated by bounded automorphisms contains a finitely generated free non - abelian group .",
    "then by theorem  [ th : mainlemma ] either there exists a free group @xmath11 generated by bounded automorphisms and having trivial stabilizer of a sequence @xmath53 , or there exists a free group @xmath11 fixing a point @xmath53 such that @xmath11 acts faithfully on every neighborhood @xmath202 of @xmath2 .",
    "suppose that the first case holds .",
    "let @xmath1 be the sub - tree of @xmath40 such that @xmath4 and the free group @xmath11 acts level transitively on @xmath1 .",
    "( the tree @xmath1 is the union of the @xmath11-orbits of beginnings of @xmath2 . )",
    "the boundary @xmath3 has to be infinite , otherwise the stabilizer of @xmath4 is of finite index . but for every @xmath203 the set of @xmath9-singular points of @xmath3 is finite , hence of zero measure .",
    "consequently , by proposition  [ pr : measureregular ] and  [ pr : griamenable ] , the components of the schreier graph of the action of @xmath11 on @xmath3 are amenable , which contradicts with triviality of the stabilizer of @xmath2 .",
    "suppose now that there exists @xmath2 such that a free 2-generated group @xmath204 fixes @xmath2 and acts faithfully on neighborhoods of @xmath2 .",
    "let @xmath205 and @xmath206 be the sets of directions of @xmath9 and @xmath111 , respectively",
    ". then @xmath207 , since otherwise there would exist a neighborhood @xmath202 of @xmath2 such that @xmath48 or @xmath208 is trivial .",
    "there exists a beginning @xmath12 of @xmath2 such that all elements of @xmath205 and @xmath206 except for @xmath2 have beginning of length @xmath209 different from @xmath12",
    ". then @xmath210 and @xmath211 are bounded automorphisms of @xmath212 with one direction @xmath213 , where @xmath214 .",
    "they generate a free group , since @xmath11 acts faithfully on @xmath215 .",
    "let @xmath216 .",
    "let @xmath217 be a number greater than the finitary depths of @xmath218 and @xmath219 .",
    "then @xmath220 and @xmath221 may change in a word @xmath222 , for @xmath223 , only the letters @xmath224 and can not change @xmath225 to @xmath226 . since the size of the alphabets @xmath227 are uniformly bounded , this implies that the automorphisms @xmath220 and @xmath221 have finite order , which is a contradiction .",
    "it is proved in  @xcite that groups generated by _ finite - state _",
    "( see definition  [ def : finitestate ] ) bounded automorphisms of a rooted tree @xmath40 are amenable , which implies that they have no free subgroups .",
    "some examples of non - finite - state groups of bounded automorphisms of @xmath40 are studied in  @xcite and  @xcite .",
    "the set of all finite state automorphisms of the tree @xmath40 is a countable group .",
    "it is proved in  @xcite that if @xmath9 is finite state then the growth function @xmath197 ( as given in definition  [ def : growthfunction ] ) has either exponential or polynomial growth .",
    "the set @xmath229 of all finite state automorphisms of @xmath40 for which @xmath197 is bounded by a polynomial of degree @xmath230 is a group .",
    "a version of the growth function @xmath197 was defined and studied by s.  sidki in  @xcite .",
    "later in  @xcite s.  sidki proved that the groups @xmath229 have no free subgroups ( actually , his theorem is more general , since it also covers some cases of infinite alphabet @xmath22 ) .",
    "let us show how his theorem ( for the case of finite alphabet ) follows from theorem  [ th : mainlemma ] .",
    "the following inductive description of elements of @xmath229 is given in  @xcite .",
    "we denote by @xmath231 the group of finitary automorphisms of @xmath40 , i.e. , the automorphisms @xmath9 for which the sequence @xmath197 is eventually zero .",
    "[ pr : polydescription ] let @xmath230 be a non - negative integer .",
    "a finite - state automorphism @xmath9 of @xmath40 belongs to @xmath229 if and only if there exists a finite number of almost periodic words @xmath232 such that the restrictions @xmath233 do not depend on @xmath18 , and @xmath234 if @xmath13 is not a beginning of any @xmath235 .",
    "it seems that the schreier graphs of subgroups of @xmath229 acting on @xmath44 have sub - exponential growth .",
    "that would of course imply their amenability .",
    "see , for instance the graphs considered in  @xcite , which are schreier graphs of a sub - group of @xmath237 ( see example  [ ex : tullio ] ) .",
    "let us show that for every @xmath238 the set of @xmath9-singular points of @xmath44 is at most countable .",
    "we argue by induction on @xmath230 .",
    "if @xmath239 , i.e. , if @xmath9 is finitary , then the set of @xmath9-singular points is empty .",
    "suppose that for every @xmath240 the set of @xmath9-singular points is at most countable .",
    "take arbitrary @xmath238 . then by proposition",
    "[ pr : polydescription ] , there is a finite set @xmath241 such that @xmath234 for every @xmath38 which is not a beginning of an element of @xmath195 .",
    "then the set @xmath60 of @xmath9-singular points of @xmath44 is a subset of @xmath242 the sets @xmath243 are at most countable by the inductive hypothesis .",
    "hence @xmath60 is at most countable .",
    "let @xmath0 be a group generated by a finite set @xmath244 .",
    "let @xmath1 be a @xmath0-invariant rooted subtree of @xmath40 on which @xmath0 acts level transitively .",
    "then the measure space @xmath245 is either a finite set , or it is isomorphic to the standard lebesgue space . in the first case",
    "the schreier graph of the action of @xmath0 on @xmath3 is finite . in the second case",
    "the components of the schreier graph of the action of @xmath0 on @xmath78 are amenable by propositions  [ pr : measureregular ] and  [ pr : griamenable ] , since the sets of @xmath9-singular points of @xmath3 for @xmath246 are at most countable , hence have zero measure .",
    "let us investigate now the groups of germs in @xmath229 .",
    "assume that we have proved that @xmath248 has no free subgroups .",
    "suppose that elements @xmath249 and @xmath250 of @xmath229 generate a free subgroup of the group of @xmath229-germs of @xmath53 .",
    "it follows from proposition  [ pr : polydescription ] that @xmath2 can be represented in the form @xmath251 for some finite words @xmath13 and @xmath12 so that @xmath252 , @xmath253 and @xmath254 and @xmath255 do not move @xmath12 .",
    "moreover , @xmath256 for @xmath257 which are not beginnings of the word @xmath258 .",
    "since @xmath249 and @xmath250 generate a free group of germs , their restrictions @xmath259 and @xmath260 onto @xmath261 generate a free group .    since @xmath262 and @xmath263 , restrictions of the action of @xmath264 and @xmath265 onto @xmath266 generate a free group @xmath11 ( everything is periodic along the path @xmath267 ) .",
    "let @xmath268 and let @xmath269 be the set of words of the form @xmath270 , where @xmath271 and @xmath272 , i.e. , the set of vertices adjacent to the path from the root to @xmath12 . denote by @xmath273 the intersection of the stabilizers in @xmath11 of the elements of @xmath274 .",
    "see figure  [ fig : u ] , where the elements of @xmath274 are circled .      then @xmath273 is a subgroup of finite index in @xmath11 and we get a monomorphism @xmath275 mapping @xmath9 to @xmath276 .",
    "the homomorphism @xmath120 takes values in @xmath277 , hence it has a non - trivial kernel on each coordinate .",
    "then , by lemma  [ lemma2 ] , the homomorphism @xmath120 has a non - trivial kernel , which is a contradiction .",
    "[ ex : tullio ] consider the permutations @xmath249 and @xmath250 of the set of integers given by @xmath278 and @xmath279 for @xmath280 and @xmath281 .",
    "let @xmath0 be the group generated by @xmath249 and @xmath250 .",
    "it is easy to see ( using the binary numeration system on @xmath282 ) that @xmath0 is isomorphic to the group of automorphisms of the binary rooted tree @xmath283 given by the recurrent rules @xmath284 and @xmath285 a direct check ( for instance using proposition  [ pr : polydescription ] ) shows that @xmath286 and @xmath287 , hence the group @xmath0 has no free subgroups by theorem of s.  sidki .",
    "the schreier graphs of the action of @xmath0 on @xmath44 coincide with the graphs considered by t.  ceccherini - silberstein , f.  fiorenzi , f.  scarabotti  @xcite and i.  benjamini , c.  hoffman  @xcite and have intermediate growth .",

    "vadim  a. kaimanovich , _ equivalence relations with amenable leaves need not be amenable _ , topology , ergodic theory , real algebraic geometry .",
    "rokhlin s memorial , amer .",
    "( 2 ) , vol . 202 , 2001 ,",
    ".  151166 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we show that if a group @xmath0 acting faithfully on a rooted tree @xmath1 has a free subgroup , then either there exists a point @xmath2 of the boundary @xmath3 and a free subgroup of @xmath0 with trivial stabilizer of @xmath2 , or there exists @xmath4 and a free subgroup of @xmath0 fixing @xmath2 and acting faithfully on arbitrarily small neighborhoods of @xmath2 . </S>",
    "<S> this can be used to prove absence of free subgroups for different known classes of groups . </S>",
    "<S> for instance , we prove that iterated monodromy groups of expanding coverings have no free subgroups and give another proof of a theorem by s.  sidki . </S>"
  ]
}
